snippet: A billionaire and critic of President Clinton, Richard Mellon Scaife, was fined $7,000 today for failing to report $200,000 in campaign contributions for ballot measures against affirmative action and labor unions.    The state Fair Political Prac...
lead_paragraph: A billionaire and critic of President Clinton, Richard Mellon Scaife, was fined $7,000 today for failing to report $200,000 in campaign contributions for ballot measures against affirmative action and labor unions. The state Fair Political Practices Commission voted 3 to 2 to approve the penalty, which stemmed from donations to two measures pushed by Gov. Pete Wilson.
abstract: Richard Mellon Scaife, billionaire and critic of Pres Clinton, is fined $7,000 for failing to report $200,000 in campaign contributions in California for ballot measures against affirmative action and labor unions (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Clinton Critic Fined For Donation Violation
